traffic signs.description: No right turn sign on the traffic light pole on the right side of the intersection
traffic signs.explanation: This sign indicates that right turns are not allowed at this intersection, affecting the possible turning maneuvers of the ego car.

traffic signs.description: Yield to pedestrians sign attached to the same pole above the no right turn sign
traffic signs.explanation: This sign instructs drivers to give way to pedestrians, which may affect the ego car's behavior when approaching the crosswalk.

traffic lights.description: Traffic light visible on the right is displaying a green signal
traffic lights.explanation: Indicates that the ego car has the right of way to proceed straight or make a left turn if legal and safe to do so.

general_perception.description and explanation: In the traffic image, there are no vehicles or vulnerable road users present. However, there are two traffic signs on the right side of the intersection. The first is a "No right turn" sign on the traffic light pole, indicating that right turns are not allowed at this intersection, which affects the possible turning maneuvers of the ego car. Above it, there is a "Yield to pedestrians" sign, instructing drivers to give way to pedestrians, potentially affecting the ego car's behavior when approaching the crosswalk. Additionally, the traffic light on the right is displaying a green signal, indicating that the ego car has the right of way to proceed straight or make a left turn if it is legal and safe to do so. There are no traffic cones, barriers, or other objects in the image.

1.description and explanation: This object is a pedestrian, an individual crossing the street at a designated crosswalk. For the ego car, it is crucial to recognize this individual to ensure safety. The presence of the pedestrian requires that the car either slow down or stop to allow them to cross safely, adhering to traffic laws that prioritize pedestrian right-of-way in crosswalks.

2.description and explanation: This label indicates 'traffic cone', typically used to guide or restrict the flow of traffic in a temporary setup. The cones are strategically placed around the corner of the intersection and might indicate ongoing roadwork or an area where driving is prohibited. For the ego car, recognizing these cones is important to avoid the restricted area and adjust the driving path accordingly. This may involve changing lanes or reducing speed to navigate safely around the cones.

3.description and explanation: This is a traffic cone, commonly used to indicate areas where vehicular traffic is restricted or to demarcate construction zones temporarily. This object suggests a likely obstruction or redirection of traffic flow near it. The ego car should proceed with caution, possibly reducing speed or preparing to change lanes if this cone indicates a closed or hazardous lane.

driving_suggestion: Proceed straight or left if legal, observing the no right turn sign and yielding to any pedestrians that may be crossing or about to cross. Maintain a safe speed and be prepared to stop if a pedestrian enters the crosswalk.
